title.rendered: Tree painting in Art on the Fly – December 10

content.rendered:
My most recent painting, the BC tree has been accepted to be shown and sold at Art on the Fly, a show which be on on December 10 2010 from 5:00 p.m. to midnight on 118 James St. North @ the Friendship Shop (next to the Tivoli).

I am very excited to have my painting shown, please come out and support Arts Hamilton, the event will have a DJ, and other fun stuff on top of the artwork.

More information on the event is here.

content.rendered:
This painting was inspired by my recent trip to British Columbia. It is from a photograph I took from Lighthouse Park in North Vancouver. My pixel painting technique is becoming more refined so I need to do less and less touch ups with each painting. I painted a border into this painting which I think looks good, but feels a bit like cheating for some reason.

My next painting will be a bit more abstract and not planned out from a photograph or photoshop and I am off to go buy a canvas now. All comments and feedback is welcome and please remember to sign up and follow my blog.

content.rendered:
This is my review for Rogers Waters performing The Wall last night at the ACC. I have included tons of photos, I am sorry the quality is so bad, all I had was my phone to take the photos.

The show was fabulous, fantastic, incredible, etc.. 11/10.
Roger took a huge portion of seats and dedicated them to the show which was great to see as he didn’t just cram us in there. They started the show with a partially built wall which a plane (seemed full sized) crashed into during the first song. Throughout the first set of the show they slowly built up the wall until intermission when it was complete. During the second set they played around the wall until the end, when it came crashing down.
I was sitting 22nd row center floor, the tickets I got from the Roger Waters website and they were worth every penny I spent on them. His voice sounded great, the stage and sound quality were awesome. Pink Floyd is one of my favourite bands, I seen them once in Oakland CA in 1994 without Roger Waters and now I have seen Roger Waters, so I am almost satisfied. When growing up through high school, Pink Floyd The Wall was like a religion to me, yes I was a bit obsessed… This was the last person that would be on my wish list of artists to see and he didn’t disappoint, as a matter of fact, he blew all other shows I have seen away…
It is kind of hard to describe the show, hopefully these photos will give you some idea…

content.rendered: I took advantage of my sick day and painted, now I am halfway done my painting and pleased with the progress. Almost no bleeds between colours and the colours are flowing together well. Below are 2 photos, after painting and after I removed the tape.

content.rendered: I just finished my first quarter of squares and established my colours. I am happy except one small complaint, I don’t have the proper blue base to mix the blues properly. I got close enough and I can live with it, but mostly I need to use up this blue before I buy another tube… So tomorrow I’ll do some final tweaks and rip off the tape and start again…

content.rendered: I finally got off my butt and started a new pixel painting piece, here it is all taped and ready to go on in the middle. Yes I know it is only tape so far, but it will soon look like the image on the right. It is a tree I photographed at Lighthouse Park in North Vancouver as seen on the left.

content.rendered:
I went to a Michael Buble concert last night and while this isn’t my usual type of music, I must admit it was a pretty good show. He is a funny guy and knows how to entertain the crowd. It is unfortunate for him that I saw Paul McCartney 2 days ago which is basically an impossible act to follow.

The opening band Naturally 7 were pretty good, 7 guys all beat boxing and singing, no instruments. It was very impressive, especially their version of While my Guitar Gently Weeps.
I will give the concert a 7/10 and the reason for losing the 3 points is because the show was fairly slow. I have heard all his CD’s and he has a lot of upbeat jazzy songs and covers, but he didn’t play many of them and kept it fairly mellow.
I don’t know the names of all the songs, so here is my version of the setlist which i will update once I get the real song names.
Cry me a river
Take it all ???
What did u think
Some nonsense song
Everything
World on a string
…Unknown love song (saved the best of me for you)
Crazy love
Georgia on my mind
For once in my life
Twist and shout
Dream if you
Good old hockey game
Home
Save the last dance for me
How sweet it is (to be loved by you) 🙂
Heartache tonight
Haven’t met u yet

Encore
Feeling good
Me and Mrs. Jones
A song for you

content.rendered:
What a show, and what great seats. A client of mine sent me tickets for the show and until I got there I had no idea how amazing the seats were. I don’t think I have ever seen a better concert and have seen many, many, many concerts. This is the only time I have seen seen Paul, but hopefully it won’t be the last, he really knows how to entertain and hearing these songs live was just incredible.. The song quality was great and Paul’ voice is still perfect, this show was 10/10. Best show I have ever seen (even better than all 150 dead shows and Garcia/Grisman at Warfield, well, maybe). I tried to get the whole set list, here it is below… (exclamations marks are for my extra excitement level, but every song was great)

Jet
All my lovin
Letting go
Drive my car !!!
Highway
Let me Roll it !!!!!
Foxy lady jam !!!!
Long and Winding road
Nineteen Hundred And Eighty-Five !!!
Let ‘Em, in
My Love
I’ve Just seen a face !
And I love her
Blackbird !!!!
Here today
Dance tonight
Mrs. Vandebilt
Elenor Rigby !!!!!
Something: first playing Ukulele – then regular !!!!!
Sing The Changes
Band on the run !!!
Ob-La-Di, Ob-La-Da !!!!!!
Back in the USSR!!!!
I got a feeling !!!!!!
Paperback writer !!!
A day in the life-Give peace a chance !!!!!!!!!
Let it be !!!
Live and let die !!!!
Hey Jude !!!!

Encore
1 Day Tripper
Lady Madonna
Get back !!!!

Encore 2 Yesterday
Mull of Kintyre
Helter Skelter !!!!!
Sgt. Pepper’s Lonely Hearts Club Band (Reprise) !!!!
The end !!!!!

content.rendered: Last week I was on vacation in BC which was very refreshing and inspiring and I did something I have never done before, I bought a painting from a small art store in Victoria. It is from an artist named Nguyen Dinh Dang from Vietnam. There was another painting which I wanted more but I couldn’t afford it, yet something about this painting interested me and still does.

content.rendered:
I haven’t seen anything Grateful Dead or even close for almost 5 years. Last show I saw was Rat Dog In Toronto, so I was very happy for this show. It was great to travel there with my son Brenden and hook up with my old friends Drew and Talli and see their 3 great kids. I also busted out the converse which have been sitting in my bookcase for the last year or so. They were unused until this show where they got broken in pretty good.

I know most of the sets Further play recently are vastly different than the Grateful Dead shows I used to see, yet it seemed this set was more like what I used to see and there was only 1 song I had never heard played before, but what a song.. Caution “Do Not Stop On Tracks”. It was about the sweetest thing I ever heard. Another great thing for me was that when I toured, songs like Alabama Getaway, Speedway, Smokestack, and Dire Wolf was once a tour songs (maybe twice) it was awesome to hear them all in one show..

At the beginning of the show I was loving the music but I was still a bit self conscious about letting loose with the dancing. What I would call the second set (but they didn’t take a break) starting with Help on the way and going to Wharf rat was so smokin. When they played this I was back in full spinner mode.
I fought the Law and Liberty, meh.. Heard them way too much, Touch of Grey was pretty sweet.. Overall, Awesome show for me..
They started the show a bit late so they skipped the intermission and played straight through. The Set list was

Alabama getaway,
Don’t ease me in,
Mama tried,
Dire wolf,
Hell in a bucket,
Bertha,
Trucking.. Smokestack Lightning
Casey Jones
I need a Miracle… Help on the way.. Caution Do not step on tracks.. New Speedway Boogie.. Wharf rat,
I fought the law
Liberty
Encore:
On the Road Again
Touch of Grey

content.rendered:
We have a yoga pass in the GTA which is called Passport to Prana, you can by it for $30 and it lets you visit many yoga studios in the GTA once. I think there are around 70 studios which participate. So I decided to review each studio that I visit using the pass. I must start by saying I am only a beginner(6 months) and my experience is limited so far to Eoin Finn videos, Kula Oakville, and Lululemon’s sunday morning free class in Sherway Gardens.

Moksha Mississuaga – 8/10

I was pleased with this class, it was a 75 minute hot yoga class. their was lots of room to spread out and a nice big wall of mirrors to monitor my posture/poses, etc.. The instructor was good, Good instructions, lots of poses, good visualization for savasana she but I didn’t see her give anyone corrections.

If I had any complaints it was that it didn’t seem like we had enough breaks (I could just be too weak 🙂 ), and they didn’t provide any hand towels for the class. i don’t know if most hot yoga studios provide hand towels or not, I just know that Kula does and I have gotten used to it..

title.rendered: Customer service is dead (or dying slowly)

content.rendered:
I had an experience today dealing with Sears / Kenmore which reminded me of my experience with godaddy a week or two back. It was very bad to say the least, my stove has malfunctioned and I had to call 5 (five) different numbers to even find someone who could find my model,and it is only 6 years old. I started by calling Sears, who couldn’t find it, the recommended I call Whirlpool who manufactures it, they bounced me around 3 numbers and then finally back to Sears. They finally found it and told me the part cost $450…

I’m not sure what else to say about this, complete and utter incompetence, I will never buy a Sears / Kenmore product and I think that is how they want it, based on how they handled my inquiry…

I suspect that when companies get large, they only want the initial sale from people and don’t care about having loyal, repeat or return customers. I know I am ranting a bit and this seems a bit immature as I read it back, but my experience with large companies in the last few months leads me to believe that this is the case.

These are the companies that fail in customer support due to their own ignorance in the past 2 months.. Rogers, Sears, godaddy and GE.

And before you start thinking I am just negative, I will say that I am happy with Toyota’s customer server

title.rendered: King Tut at AGO is not good

content.rendered: Too bad I saw the show on the last day. While it did have some interesting items, it was missing all the big items such as the mask, sarcophagus, shrine, coffins and throne. I would say the exhibit was a very big rip off. I think this tour is going to Denver next, if you live there, save your money.

title.rendered: Concert Review – Mark Knopfler at Massey Hall

content.rendered:
The summer is coming and I realized I have a whole bunch of concerts to go to this year and I thought it would be fun to review them. The first up is Mark Knopler at Massey Hall last night.

The concert was pretty mellow and he playing much of his solo work and it seemed like most people were just waiting for his Dire Straits hits. I liked his solo work and his style of playing and I was very happy to not hear 3 minute songs with no jams. His band had many great acoustic and electric jam sessions with a good assortment of instruments. He did bust out 2 big Dire Straits songs, Sultans of Swing and So far Away and while it was great to hear those songs, it almost seemed like he rushed through them compared to some of the newer stuff. I was a bit disappointed that he didn’t play “You can’t beat the House” from his Get Lucky album which is my favorite song from it.

Massey Hall kind of sucked, or least my seats did, I was up on the top level and the seats were so close your knees were tight against the seat in front of you. if you ever go to Massey, I recommend you pay the extra $20 or more for the lower levels. The sound was pretty good in there.

So lets rate this show..

Venue (2): 0
Sound (4): 3
Music (4): 4

So this show is a 7/10.

content.rendered:
I have finally finished this painting, it took 8 months to finish and I must admit that I am very happy to see it finished. The lighter tones are much less forgiving than the darker tones when using this style. I almost gave up on it, but the last 2 weeks I got a bit of a fire to hurry up and get it done.

I am going to paint something much simpler next time, lets see what I can create with Adobe Illustrator.

content.rendered: I just saw the Hurt Locker and really liked the movie. The part that really stood out to me was Srg. James being an adrenalin junkie. While I have never been in a war and hope to never have to, to a lesser degree I can relate to the loving adrenalin and living on the edge. makes me think of all the crazy things I used to, scare myself for the fun of it, over and over again

Sorry for the poor video quality, Blogger compressed it a but too much.

content.rendered:
I am going to start a new habit, every time I use the computer at home, I need to be sitting on the exercise ball. It doesn’t seem like much, but I am finding that after doing this for 30 minutes, I can feel it in my abs… I spend all day on the computer and need all the help I can get.

Lets hope I don’t give up or forget too soon…

content.rendered:
For many years I resisted doing yoga. Friends of mine would always invite me to try and for some reason I held back. Over the Christmas holidays I finally started and have found that I am now doing it every day. Each morning I will do it for 5 minutes or so as soon as I wake up and in the evening I will do a routine for one hour or so. Usually I will do an Eoin Finn video, and he has some great videos. This is his website http://www.eoinfinnyoga.com.

What I am finding is that my core (mid section) is the weakest part of me, and I am held back from many poses because of this weakness. So for now, core work and balance exercises are what I am concentrating on.

content.rendered:
Hello,

I had a very odd experience the last few weeks. For about 2 weeks I could not connect to google.com or google.ca at all from either of my home computers. It is the default page for all my browsers and I would always get a DNS error, yet I could connect to any other webpage.
So after the 2 frustrating weeks I called Rogers my ISP and complained about this. At the same time that I was complaining I was refreshing my browser and pinging www.google.com over and over again. Not even 30 seconds after I complained to Rogers, it worked and as worked ever since.
They blamed it on my router, but I did not reboot it as they suggested. Am I correct in being a little suspicious of this, or am I just paranoid. The whole incident seems fishy…

content.rendered:
It has been awhile but I’m back at it. I am now halfway done my new pixel rose piece. It is coming out well, almost no bleeds between squares and I’m following the background pattern fairly precisely.

I do think I am getting sick of painting squares (it has been almost 3 months that I started this) and will go in another direction for my next painting.

content.rendered:
In my pixel glow painting I decided I wanted to varnish my painting. I have never done this before and thought it would help the painting to last without fading, so I bought a golden acrylic spray matte varnish and very quickly messed up my painting. It looked like crap, all the outside tones were blended into one and you could see the spray marks and cloudy spots.

I called a few art restoration places and got quotes from anywhere between $150 – $500 to remove the varnish, they told me that because it was acrylic varnish on acrylic paint that it would be very difficult and time consuming. The Golden website tells you how to do it but warns that it is difficult and you should hire a professional. Today, I went to Curry’s and talked to a guy there and he told me what to do (he has done it before so spoke with confidence), which is similar to what the Golden Acrylic website says. Basically just buy mineral spirits, coat the painting for 2-5 minutes and slowly pad off the spirits and varnish with a old shirt.

It actually worked great and in 2 hours I basically have it perfect again. One extra thing I used was a sponge which is floor mop, the inside sponge is normal and it has a crustier outside sponge layer. By the 3rd coat I was more confident that the painting wouldn’t melt from the spirits, so I coated the whole thing in mineral spirits and scrubbed it with the sponge. I still have maybe 1 more coat to do to help clear off the edges but I am pretty happy. I thought I ruined a painting which took a month to paint and was worried it could possibly cost up to $500 to save. I fixed it in 2 hours and spent $5 on the mineral spirits. Here is a photo of the sponge mop I used to apply the spirits and scrub it down.

content.rendered:
I’m starting a new painting which can be seen in the image below, it is a new pixel rose, this one pink and white. I’m a bit stuck on inspiration at this time and keep finding myself drawn to roses over and over again. I think it is because they have nice curves and gradients which work so well with this style of painting.

You can see the template below which I created in Photoshop. I lightly painted the canvas before applying tape, this is for when I occasionally miss on the taping and a small line is left between coats of paint, it doesn’t end up being noticeable when the background is a similar colour. I also use a spoon now to make the tape tight with the canvas and have no bleeds.

I’ll be posting my progress with this painting as I go, please come back soon to watch it.

content.rendered:
Hello,

This is my latest pixel painting. A very simple design which required a very complex process to get to. I pre-mixed 37 shades of the dark crimson red. Another technique I used for the taping is to use a spoon to smooth out the tape, it’s rounded edges don’t break the tape or canvas and I use the side of the spoon where the 2 lines of tape meet (a small gap is created at that spot).

content.rendered: This is my final video in the blue proof experiment. I have now done 4 paintings since my return to fine art and i am ready to do some serious pieces.. or least fun pieces.. What I learned with this experiment is to pre-mix my colors and NOT put the paint on too thick over the canvas. The effect of smooth thick paint looks nice, but it tends to rip and get jagged edges when you peel off the tape. Perhaps layering would work (tape, paint, rip, repeat). Stay tuned, I have started a new piece will have a video shortly. I am now venturing into Op-Art which was always my favorite style.

content.rendered: A progress video of my Blue proof experiment painting. I learned a few tricks which will help for the next paintings such as using the pallet knife to remove paint strokes and layering my tape to give the painting depth.

content.rendered:
I have started a new series of videos for a new painting. I am having fun with this as I am relearning both painting and video editing at the same time. I am having just as much fun learning Adobe After Effects while I edit the video, as I do painting and filming the process.

Please don’t be confused that I call the painting Pixel Paint 201 in the video, I hadn’t thought of a name when i first started filming.

I use some new techniques for this painting, One is using double tape in order to bring the paint off the canvas. The second technique I started using is a pallet knife to apple the paint.

content.rendered:
Hello,
There has been a delay with this painting, but we are back on track now. This is a progress lesson and our plan is to have the final revealing this coming weekend. I use the word “random” often in this video when describing colour placement, but what I mean to say is “slight variations with no 2 colours matching 100%”.

Here is the video below.

content.rendered:
Hello,

I started as a fine artist before I got into web development. It became more of a hobby when I discovered graphic design and web development.

This is a tutorial for a style of painting I did many years ago. Basically zoomed in bitmap images. The interesting thing is that I did these painting before I learned about graphic design and bitmaps.

Hope full this painting will be done in 2-3 weeks, I will post a couple more videos of my progress as well as the final piece.
